intro: Verbascum rhinanthifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mullein, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, velvety leaves. The plant produces showy yellow or orange flowers in late summer, which attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. Verbascum rhinanthifolium is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters.
